duties_responsibilities.duty: Process and administer all facets of multi-state weekly and biweekly payroll for 2000 employees/over 80 locations/and over + 30 States (and growing) using UKG Workforce.
Generate and develop management and payroll-related reports using UKG BI and Excel.
Track benefit accruals and balances to ensure accuracy.
Review and ensure accuracy of timesheets.
Provide customer service in a timely manner to payroll inquiries from operating branches and employees.
Coordinate the setup of direct deposit.
Research guidelines and regulations in operating states to ensure compliance.
Partnering with the Payroll Administrators to identify opportunities for process improvement by eliminating non-value add activity and/or leveraging technology, analyze, and implement accordingly.
Assist with audit requests as required.
Any other tasks as deemed necessary by management.

education_certification.credential: Knowledge of UKG, Ulti-Pro or Kronos a plus.
Effective verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to prioritize, recognize and meet deadlines.
Ability to maintain integrity of confidential information.
Desire to work in a fast-paced environment with varied responsibilities.
Must be authorized to lawfully work in the U.S.
Physical demands: The employee is subject to frequently lift and/or move up to fifty (50) pounds. Occasionally lift and/or move over fifty (50) pounds.
